document.masterDocTitle: Description of two new species of the genus Siniassus (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Iassinae: Hyalojassini) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of two new species of the genus Siniassus (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Iassinae: Hyalojassini) from China

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of
Siniassus
(males), modified from
Dai et al. (2010)
and
Wang et al. (2018)

paragraph.keyLead:
2 Pygofer without setae on caudo-dorsal area ( Fig. 29 ).................................................
S. aspinus

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 27–39.
Siniassus species.
27.
S. loberus ( Dai, Zhang & Zhang, 2010 )
, male pygofer, lateral view; 28.
S. compressus ( Dai, Zhang & Zhang, 2010 )
, male pygofer, lateral view; 29.
S. aspinus ( Dai, Zhang & Zhang, 2010 )
, male pygofer, caudal view; 30.
S. loberus ( Dai, Zhang & Zhang, 2010 )
, male pygofer, caudal view; 31.
S. hamulus Wang, Wu & Dai, 2018
, subgenital plate, ventral view; 32.
S. loberus ( Dai, Zhang & Zhang, 2010 )
, subgenital plate, ventral view; 33.
S. aspinus ( Dai, Zhang & Zhang, 2010 )
, subgenital plate, ventral view; 34.
S. aspinus ( Dai, Zhang & Zhang, 2010 )
, style, lateral view; 35.
S. compressus ( Dai, Zhang & Zhang, 2010 )
, aedeagus, lateral view; 36.
S. webbi (Dai & Dietrich, 2010)
, aedeagus, lateral view; 37.
S. compressus ( Dai, Zhang & Zhang, 2010 )
, style, lateral view; 38.
S. webbi (Dai & Dietrich, 2010)
, style, lateral view; 39.
S. loberus ( Dai, Zhang & Zhang, 2010 )
, style, lateral view.

paragraph.keyLead:
3 Subgenital plate nearly rectangular, apex obliquely truncate with inner margin shorter than outer margin distinctly ( Fig. 31 )............................................................................................
S. hamulus

4 Style narrowed gradually toward base ( Fig. 23 ).........................................
S. nigrimaculatus
sp. nov.

6 Style bent at obtuse angle at base ( Fig. 39 ), aedeagus with posteroventral lobe.............................
S. loberus

- Style elongate with evenly tapered base ( Fig. 12 ), aedeagus without posteroventral lobe..............
S. gracilitus
sp. nov.
